tool.name: Run SCCAF

param.name: use_tsv
param.label: Use external cluster information
param.help: If the provided AnnData/Loom file does not include the clustering, or if you want to use an external clustering assigment.

param.name: input_tsv
param.label: Cluster table for assessment in tsv format

param.name: obj_attr
param.label: Attribute in input object that contains cluster information
param.help: If you are not using an external clustering, then you must specify the slot/index in the AnnData or Loom file where the clustering to be used for assessment (and potentially optimisation starting point) is saved.

param.name: optimise
param.label: Run clustering optimisation
param.help: By default the tool only runs an assesment of the clustering quality. To further optimise the clustering, enable this option.

param.name: from_input
param.label: Use input clustering to initialise optimisation
param.help: This option uses the previously specified clustering (either external file provided or internal index/slot specified) to serve as starting point for the optimisation process.

param.name: resolution
param.label: Resolution for initialising louvain clustering
param.help: Perform an initial clustering and use this as an starting point.

param.name: condition
param.help: How should the optimisation algorithm be stopped.
param.label: Stop condition
param.option: Use a slot with a low resolution clustering

param.name: accuracy
param.label: Accuracy for convergence of the optimisation process
param.help: The SCCAF optimisation process will converge once this accuracy is achieved.

param.name: min_resolution_clustering_slot
param.label: Underclustering boundary to use in the optimisation.
param.help: The slot inside the ann data object with the desired underclustering (low resolution) to be used as exit condition.

param.name: skip_init_assessment
param.label: Run only the optimisation and skip the initial assessment
param.help: If you are running the optimisation, you can choose skip the initial assessment to save time.

param.name: distribute_assesment
param.label: Produce parameter walk for asessment distribution
param.help: Will split rounds in files so that multiple assess processes can be distributed down the line

param.name: citer
param.label: Number of iterations of sampling for the confusion matrix.
param.help: By default is 3, higher numbers mean more stable results (number of rounds) but also longer execution times.

data.name: output_png
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string} ROC Curve for initial assesment

data.name: optim_png
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string} ROC Curve for optimisation result

tool.help:
@SCCAF_INTRO@
Inputs ------
* AnnData object which contains the expression matrix and pre-calculated coordinates for UMAP. The AnnData object can include already clustering data, in which case the user will need to know on which AnnData slot/label is contained. * Optional external text file with mappings between cells and clusters (when no clustering is given inside the AnnData file).
Modes of operation ------------------
* Optimisation with exit condition based on accuracy cut-off. In this case the user provides a minimum cut-off for the accuracy to be achieved and the optimisation process will exit at that point. * Optimisation with exit condition based on under-clustered scenario. In the case the AnnData object given must include a low resolution, under clustered clustering, and its label must be know to be specified. * Assesment only (no optimisation), where an existing clustering is assessed.
This is resource intensive.
Distributed assesment ---------------------
If running the optimisation you can distribute assessments of the optimisation results. For this, activate the "Produce parameter walk for assessment distribution" option, which will generate a "Rounds for assesment distribution". Then feed the AnnData output of the optimisation process and the rounds output to the SCCAF Assesment module. Then merge all assessment results with SCCAF Assesment Merger (this also receives the rounds output). The workflow would look like this:
